collection:
The Personal Information Protection and Electronic Documents Act (PIPEDA)  
  

Informally, we do not collect, store nor share any personal data beyond the
data which is generated from within the WorkSchool 365 software activities
such as filling-in Excel workbook-quizzes or video-chat-seminars within the
Teams shared rooms.

Formally, we process your personal data as-if your WorkSchool 365 account is
located in Canada, in accordance with the Personal Information Protection and
Electronic Documents Act (PIPEDA):

[https://www.priv.gc.ca/en/privacy-topics/privacy-laws-in-canada/the-personal-
information-protection-and-electronic-documents-act-
pipeda/](https://www.priv.gc.ca/en/privacy-topics/privacy-laws-in-canada/the-
personal-information-protection-and-electronic-documents-act-pipeda/)

You have the right to request that we: (1) disclose what personally-
identifiable data we collect, use, disclose, and sell and (2) delete your
personally-identifiable data.

The data we may or may not collect, store, or
share are:

**Name and contact data**.

Only your personal internet address (email) is
collected or stored or shared from within the software.

We do **not** collect
or store your first name and surname, postal address, phone number, and other
similar contact data.

Your Microsoft Teams profile only includes the email
information you provided when signing-on via Microsoft.

We do **not** collect or store passwords, password hints, and
similar security information.

We do **not** collect or store data about you such as
your age, gender, country, and preferred language.

We do **not** collect or
store data to process payments, such as your payment instrument number (such
as a credit card number) and the security code associated with your payment
instrument.

We do **not** collect, store nor share any other
content type for other unrelated purposes, such as:

         Communications, including audio, video, text (typed, inked, dictated, or otherwise), in a message, email, call, meeting request, or chat.

WorkSchool 365 for businesses or universities

If your end-user use of WorkSchool 365 is correlated to a business-or-
university instance of the WorkSchool 365 software, then such organization
can: control and administer your end-user account; access and process your
data generated from within the software activities.

No sensitive personal data is
collected, stored nor shared, most data from within the software should
already be public information elsewhere.
